column4: I just can't understand why ubuntu cannot handle dial-up modems ( on laptops) I tough that it was the easiest of the ways to connect to internet. And I don't get it that it wasn'nt a priority. Ubuntu is supposed to help people who cannot afford an expensive OS, like in poor countries ( africa). Do you think that they all have Wifi and ADSL?
you should have checked to see if your modem was supported to begin with
and ubuntu is not supposed to help people who cannot afford an expensive OS... thats not the mission statement or goal
